intro: Boerhavia greenwayi, commonly known as the greenway's bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a low-growing annual herb with fleshy, succulent stems and small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a shallow root system adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Boerhavia greenwayi is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, desert environments, making it an important component of local flora.
